intro: Wahlenbergia undulata var. striata, commonly known as the zigzag bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue and purple, often with a white throat. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a wavy, undulating edge, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments.
